Glass Bottle.name: Glass Bottle
Glass Bottle.description:
Glass bottles are not biodegradable, but glass particles can still leach
 into the water and enter the food chain. These particles are very harmful to organisms.

Aluminium Can.name: Aluminium Can
Aluminium Can.description:
Even though this container isn't made from plastic, it releases about
 twice the amount of CO2 during production, compared to a plastic bottle.

HDPE Bottle.name: HDPE Bottle
HDPE Bottle.description:
Plastic bottles are very common in the ocean. Around 250 billion plastic
 bottles are not recycled and a large portion of that ends up in the oceans.

Styrofoam.name: Styrofoam
Styrofoam.description:
Plastic foam is not recyclable, compostable or biodegradable. These attributes
 make this material one of the worst to produce. It is not ECO friendly.

Bubble-Wrap.name: Bubble-Wrap
Bubble-Wrap.description:
Some types of bubble-wrap are made to be biodegradable within 90 days, however they
 still leech harmful microplastics and hormone-disrupting chemicals.

Diaper.name: Diaper
Diaper.description:
Disposable Diapers contain a lot of plastics that leech into the ocean. They also contain Tributyltin(TBT),
 which is a biocide that is poisonous to marine life.

PVC Pipe.name: PVC Pipe
PVC Pipe.description:
PVC plastic in the ocean, leeches microplastics into the water. They also release chlorine-based
 chemicals called dioxins, that are very toxic to marine life and humans.
